alert.note: Alert for Eastern Aleutians (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 28 at 3:52AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS, WET SNOW AND RAIN FOR UNALASKA TODAY... A strong front will move over the Island today bringing a mix of wet snow, strong winds and rain. Winds will increase out of the south throughout the day, with gusts ranging from 55 to 65 mph expected this afternoon. Precipitation will start out as snow, but temperatures at sea level ranging from 34 to 37 degrees should limit accumulation. A transition to rain is likely this afternoon or evening. Snow accumulations at sea level will range from 1 to 3 inches, with up to 6 inches expected for those above sea level. Blowing snow, heavy snow and winds up to 75 mph are likely at higher elevations above town. Travel may be difficult at times today due to strong winds and slushy snow.
